page.title: 02Pitlessie Village
page.content: Pitlessie village is bordered by the River Eden to the north and the A92 to the south east.The village obviously came into existence due to the river. Houses in the village are generally of the small cottage type, many of which are centuries old.Larger stone built houses, also fairly old, are to be found in the{older, more central part {of the village.}Only a few privately built modern houses exist, along with two groups of post war council houses. There are few amenities in Pitlessie, a{Post Office/village shop, hotel, {primary school, village hall and a {public park.}All other amenities have to be sought outwith the village. The village was at one time a thriving community.But this activity has dwindled over this century and Pitlessie has become, as many others, a{pleasantly quiet dormitory village.
